name: GetZoomMeetingCaptionToken
description:
Retrieve a closed caption token for a Zoom meeting.

Retrieves a closed caption token for a specified Zoom meeting, allowing integration with third-party closed captioning services. Ensure the Closed Captioning setting is enabled in the Zoom portal.

parameters.name: zoom_meeting_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Zoom meeting. Store as a long format integer, since meeting IDs can exceed 10 digits.

value_schema.description:
The meeting's ID. 

 When storing this value in your database, you must store it as a long format integer and **not** an integer. Meeting IDs can exceed 10 digits.

parameters.name: meeting_token_type
parameters.description: The type of meeting token to retrieve, defaults to 'closed_caption_token'.

value_schema.description:
The meeting token type. 
* `closed_caption_token` - The third-party closed caption API token. 

This defaults to `closed_caption_token`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Zoom Meetings API.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The meeting token type. 
* `closed_caption_token` - The third-party closed caption API token. 

This defaults to `closed_caption_token`.

value_schema.description:
The meeting token type. 
* `closed_caption_token` - The third-party closed caption API token. 

This defaults to `closed_caption_token`.

parameters.name: meetingId
parameters.description:
The meeting's ID. 

 When storing this value in your database, you must store it as a long format integer and **not** an integer. Meeting IDs can exceed 10 digits.

value_schema.description:
The meeting's ID. 

 When storing this value in your database, you must store it as a long format integer and **not** an integer. Meeting IDs can exceed 10 digits.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
